title: Get the budget change history of an ad account

headers.name: Access-Token
headers.description: Authorized access token. For details, see Authentication .

parameters.name: bc_id
parameters.description: Business Center ID. To obtain the list of Business Centers that you have access to, use /bc/get/ .

parameters.name: advertiser_id
parameters.description: Ad account ID. To obtain the list of ad accounts that you have access to, use /bc/asset/get/ . Set asset_type to ADVERTISER and select ad accounts with the returned advertiser_role as ADMIN , OPERATOR , or ANALYST .

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: Query start date, in the format of YYYY-MM-DD (UTC+0 time). You can either specify start_date and end_date simultaneously or leave both start_date and end_date unspecified. If you specify start_date and end_date simultaneously, the maximum time range is 365 days. If you leave both start_date and end_date unspecified, the results for the last seven days will be returned by default. Example: 2025-01-01 .

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: Query end date, in the format of YYYY-MM-DD (UTC+0 time). You can either specify start_date and end_date simultaneously or leave both start_date and end_date unspecified. If you specify start_date and end_date simultaneously, the maximum time range is 365 days. If you leave both start_date and end_date unspecified, the results for the last seven days will be returned by default. Example: 2025-02-01 .

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Current page number. Value range: â‰¥ 1. Default value: 1.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: Page size. Value range: 1-50. Default value: 10.

top_fields.name: code
top_fields.description: Response code. For the complete list of response codes and descriptions, see Appendix-Return Code .

top_fields.name: message
top_fields.description: Response message. For details, see Appendix - Return Codes .

top_fields.name: request_id
top_fields.description: The log ID of a request, which uniquely identifies the request.

fields.name: operation_time
fields.description: The time when the budget change occurred, in the format of YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS (UTC+0 time). Example: 2025-01-01 00:00:01 .

fields.name: activity_type
fields.description: Change type. Enum values: RESET : Reset the one-time budget consumption of the ad account to 0. BUDGET_MODE_UPDATE : Change the budget mode to monthly, daily, or one-time. INCREASE_BUDGET : Increase budget without changing budget mode. DECREASE_BUDGET : Decrease budget without changing budget mode. REMOVE_BUDGET : Change the budget mode to unlimited.

fields.name: previous_budget
fields.description: The previous budget amount of the ad account before the change, kept to two decimal places.

fields.name: previous_budget_mode
fields.description: The previous budget mode of the ad account. Enum values: UNLIMITED : Unlimited budget. No budget limit for the ad account. MONTHLY_BUDGET : Monthly budget. The ad account consumes Business Center credit line within the monthly budget. DAILY_BUDGET : Daily budget. The ad account consumes Business Center credit line within the daily budget. CUSTOM_BUDGET : One-time budget (custom budget). The ad account consumes Business Center credit line within the one-time custom budget.

fields.name: current_budget
fields.description: The current budget amount of the ad account after the change, kept to two decimal places.

fields.name: current_budget_mode
fields.description: The current budget mode of the ad account. Enum values: UNLIMITED : Unlimited budget. No budget limit for the ad account. MONTHLY_BUDGET : Monthly budget. The ad account consumes Business Center credit line within the monthly budget. DAILY_BUDGET : Daily budget. The ad account consumes Business Center credit line within the daily budget. CUSTOM_BUDGET : One-time budget (custom budget). The ad account consumes Business Center credit line within the one-time custom budget.

fields.name: currency
fields.description: The currency for the current budget, in ISO 4217 code format. Example: EUR .

fields.name: operator_id
fields.description: The user ID of the operator.

fields.name: operator_name
fields.description: The user name of the operator.
